questionTitle: He was surprised that her English was so ________ as she had never been to England.
I went to ________ some pictures by a new painter the other day.
If it ________ fine, I shall go out.
The idea of a balanced diet is very difficult to ________ to anyone who knows nothing about food values.
There was a small room into ________ we all crowded.
You ________ go to dentist's before your toothache gets worse.
Hilda: Was the Minister's speech interesting? Miles: Yes, at first, but it was ________ long.
Dr Bannister has been on ________ for twenty-four hours without a break.
When he braked suddenly on the icy road, the car ________.
This is the ________ church in the city.
You must put your name and address on this side of the form, and then sign on the ________ side.
We will always ________ the wonderful winter holiday we had in Austria.
The president ________ his intention to retire before the next election.
As he walked through the fields, he heard sheep ________.
I'm afraid I can't comment ________ your work just yet.
He was employed ________ a factory before he joined the army.
It was ________ that they decided to go mountain-climbing.
I think he ________ you my regards when you met.
Not ________ did she refuse to speak to him, but she also vowed never to see him again.
to come through flying colours = ________.
anwers: to arrive somewhere in a state of nervousness
to be understood loud and clear
to accomplish something with great success
to succeed in one's first year of study
